explanation.num_tested_probands: The case report details only one individual patient referred to the movement disorders outpatient clinic and genetic testing was performed on this individual.
explanation.num_positive_het_probands: There are no probands reported to be heterozygous for a pathogenic variant.
explanation.positive_phenotypes: The phenotypes associated with the patient include severe hyperkinetic movement disorder, dystonia, chorea, ballism, cognitive deficits, and developmental delay.
explanation.num_compound_or_double_hets: The patient has compound heterozygous mutations in the WARS2 gene, with one pathogenic variant inherited from the father and another from the mother.

num_tested_probands: Here we present a patient with biallelic variants in WARS2 and clinical phenotype consisting of a severe hyperkinetic move- ment disorder and cognitive deficits.
num_positive_het_probands: No pathogenic or likely pathogenic variants were detected in the mitochondrial DNA.
positive_phenotypes: hyperkinetic movement disorder with dys- tonia, chorea, and ballism:
severe hyperkinetic movement disorder and cognitive deficits.
num_compound_or_double_hets: Based on the suspected autosomal recessive pattern of inheritance, we prioritized genes carrying biallelic vari- ants in the index and detected 2 variants in WARS2

explanation.num_tested_probands: The case report included only one patient presented in the movement disorders clinic in 2018.
explanation.num_positive_het_probands: The 31-year-old patient presented with phenotypes consistent with WARS2 mutations.
explanation.positive_phenotypes: The clinical presentation of the patient included severe hyperkinetic movement disorder and uncontrollable dystonic and ballistic movements.
explanation.num_compound_or_double_hets: There was no mention of compound or double heterozygous mutations in the case report.
